# Assignments

```{r}
a <- 3
b <- 5
print(a + b)
```

```{r}
x <- "hi"
print(x)
```

# Basic Data Structures

1. `vector`
  - `matrix`
2. `list`
3. `data.frame`


## Vector

```{r}
my_data <- c(1,2,3,4,5)
print(my_data)
```


# Data Types

1. integer
2. double
3. factor
4. character
5. logical

## integer

```{r}
my_int <- c(1L, 2L)
str(my_int)
```
```{r}
is.integer(my_int)
```
```{r}
class(my_int)
```
```{r}
is.character(my_int)
```



# Useful Functions

1. `length(object)`: number of elements or components
1. `str(object)`  : structure of an object
1. `class(object)`: class or type of an object
1. `names(object)`: names


# Operators

```{r}
3 / 4
3 ** 2
```

# Boolean Logic

```
TRUE & FALSE
FALSE | TRUE
```
